intro: Hermesias coccinea, commonly known as the scarlet bower vine, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It is characterized by its vibrant red flowers that bloom in clusters, attracting pollinators such as hummingbirds and bees. The plant has climbing stems that can reach several meters in length, often using tendrils to attach to supports. Its leaves are heart-shaped and have a glossy texture, contributing to its ornamental appeal. Botanically, it belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes other showy flowering plants.
